title: Detective1.1
body: Victim is John Doe, aged 34. Cause of death was likely loss of blood. [[Answer:Player1.1|Player2.1]] [[Answer:Player6.1|Player6.1]] [[Answer:PlayerEnd01|PlayerEnd01]]

title: Player2.1
body: Oh, so his name was actually John Doe. And he's a deer. Huh [[Answer:Detective3.1|Detective3.1]]

title: Detective3.1
body: He's also an accountant, but you don't seem to care about that [[Answer:Player4.1|Player4.1]]

title: Player4.1
body: People don't identify unknown bodies as "John CPA". It's an interesting coincidence. Sue me [[Answer:Detective5.1|Detective5.1]]

title: Detective5.1
body: Mulligan, would you focus please? [[Answer:Player6.1|Player6.1]]

title: Player6.1
body: Right. What's the coroner have to say? [[Answer:Detective7.2|Detective7.2]]

title: Detective7.2D
body: <clue>Frankenstein is back, and he's still arrogant and odd to talk to</clue>Well, you know how the good doctor is. He doesn't so much say things as state them, with the confidence that you'll find it as fascinating as he does. And they're never anything anyone [i]should[/i] find fascinating. [[Answer:Player8.1|Player8.1]]

title: Detective7.2
body: Well, Frankenstein just got us the preliminary report an hour ago, but the victim died of blood loss, not of any trauma from the claws. It can't have been a fun way to go. <clue>Victim died slowly, likely painfully</clue> [[Answer:Player8.1|Player7.2A]] [[Answer:Player8.2|Player8.2]]

title: Player7.2A
body: Frankenstein? No kidding, huh. He's still working? [[Answer:Detective7.2B|Detective7.2B]]

title: Detective7.2B
body: That old man will die of a heart attack, scalpel in hand, because he doesn't have the good sense to just retire. [[Answer:Player7.2C|Player7.2C]]

title: Player7.2C
body: I'm guessing he's still the same creepy old man, then. [[Answer:Detective8.2|Detective7.2D]]

title: Player8.1
body: Strange man he may be, but I've always trusted his gut. Off the record, what's he saying here?  [[Answer:Detective9.1|Detective9.1]]

title: Player8.2
body: Oh, c'mon. I know ol' Vic could never resist gossipping as he hands off the report on a grisly murder. What's he saying, off the record? [[Answer:Detective9.1|Detective9.1]]

title: Detective9.1
body: Something in his gut says that the speed wasn't accidental. Whoever killed John wanted it painful. This was personal. [[Answer:Detective10.2|Detective10.2]]

title: Detective10.2
body: Somebody with motive and enough political backing to want to bury the case. [[Answer:Player9.3|Player9.3]]

title: Player9.3
body: Really? You think the Wolfingtons would stoop so low? [[Answer:Detective9.4|Detective9.4]]

title: Detective9.4
body: My ass is on the line if I tell you anything.<clue>Whoever this was, they have some serious political weight around town</clue> [[Answer:Player10.1|Player10.1a]] [[Answer:Player10.2|Player10.2]]

title: Player10.1a
body: Please, Priscilla? You know I wouldn't be asking if innocent lives weren't on the line.<cngVar>diwFavor 10</cngVar> [[Answer:Detective10.1b|Detective10.1b]]

title: Player10.2
body: Please? You have to. If I don't crack this case, I'm eating ramen for a month. [[Answer:Detective10.2b|Detective10.2b]]

title: Detective10.1b
body: Ok, well I'm telling you this because this case is personal and any detail might crack it for you. [[Answer:Detective10.1c|Detective10.1c]]

title: Detective10.1c
body: The only person in this town powerful enough to quake Chief Montgomery in his boots is Ol' Daddy Wolfington. Both of his boys are major hotheads. I'd start there.<clue>The current prime suspects are the two Wolfington brothers</clue><cngVar>wolfSuspect 5</cngVar> [[Answer:Player11.1|Player11.1a]]

title: Detective10.2b
body: You know, that actually seems very character building. [[Answer:Detective10.2c|Detective10.2c]]

title: Detective10.2c
body: I shan't stand in the way of you reliving your college days. [[Answer:Player11.2a|Player11.2a]] [[Answer:Player11.3a|Player11.3a]]

title: Player11.1a
body: Thank you so much. This information will bring justice, I promise. [[Answer:Player11.1b|Player11.1b]]

title: Player11.1b
body: By the way... [[Answer:Player11.1c|Player11.1c]]

title: Player11.1c
body: Can you think of anything else? [[Answer:Detective12.1a|Detective12.1a]]

title: Player11.2a
body: Priscilla I'm sorry that was insensitive. [[Answer:Player11.2b|Player11.2b]]

title: Player11.3a
body: Oh ha ha ha. Very funny.<cngVar>diwOutOFFavor 5</cngVar> [[Answer:Detective10.3b|Detective10.3b]]

title: Player11.2b
body: But lives are on the line here. Please. [[Answer:Player11.2c|Player11.2c]]

title: Player11.2c
body: Is there anything you can tell me? [[Answer:Detective12.1a|Detective12.1a]]

title: Detective10.3b
body: Has anyone ever hit you with a golf club? <clue>Golf?</clue> [[Answer:Player1.3c|Player1.3c]] [[Answer:Player10.3d|Player10.3d]]

title: Player1.3c
body: Yeah, once. During a riot. Few years back.<cngVar>diwOutOfFavor 5</cngVar> [[Answer:Detective10.3f|Detective10.3f]]

title: Player10.3d
body: Nope. Can't say I've had the pleasure [[Answer:Detective10.3e|Detective10.3e]]

title: Detective10.3e
body: Well someone should. I'll throw you a bone and tell you something small. [[Answer:Detective12.1a|Detective12.1a]]

title: Detective10.3f
body: Ugh you lying sack of shit. Get out of my sight.

title: Detective12.1a
body: Well, that's probably the killer's blood at the entrance to the alley. [[Answer:Detective12.1b|Detective12.1b]]<clue>Collect Killer's blood from alley entrance</clue>

title: Detective12.1b
body: Get some of that, some that's definitely Doe's, then some DNA from both brothers. [[Answer:Detective12.1c|Detective12.1c]]<clue>Collect DNA from both Wolfenstein brothers</clue>

title: Detective12.1c
body: Have Frankenstein run DNA tests, up in his bizarre mixed up business.<clue>Have Frankenstein run the tests in the mixed up business</clue> [[Answer:Detective12.1d|Detective12.1d]]

title: Detective12.1d
body: I'll arrest the guilty brother. <clue>Win!</clue>

title: PlayerEnd01
body: Sorry to bother you. Goodbye.
